examples.text: Only a small portion of the budget is spent on books.
The central portion of the bridge collapsed.
You give this portion of the ticket to the inspector and keep the other.
She could recite large portions of Shakespeare.

definitions.definition: an amount of food that is large enough for one person

examples.text: She cut the cake into six small portions.
You should eat several portions of fruit a day.
This particular type of fish has less than 200 calories per portion.
Divide the mixture into individual portions and place them on a baking tray.
He ordered a double portion of ham and eggs.

definitions.definition: a part of something that is shared with other people

examples.text: You must accept a portion of the blame for this crisis.

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French porcion, from Latin portio(n-), from the phrase pro portione ‘in proportion’.
